headline: Analyst Says Expedia Stock is ‘Darn Cheap’
summary: Mark Mahaney, Evercore ISI head of internet research, said in a latest program on CNBC that Expedia (EXPE) is his top pick because the stock’s valuation is cheap. The analyst explains the reasons why he’s bullish on the stock: “Expedia is one of our top picks for the year. It’s kind of a contrarian call […]

headline: Will Lemonade (LMND) Elevate Its Global Brand Strategy With New Board Appointment?
summary: On October 6, 2025, Lemonade announced the appointment of Geoff Seeley, Chief Marketing Officer of PayPal, to its board of directors as a Class I director through 2027. Seeley brings a strong track record in global marketing and technology-driven customer growth at brands like PayPal, Afterpay, and Airbnb, signaling Lemonade's plans to advance its global marketing and consumer reach. We'll explore how Seeley's addition to Lemonade's board could influence the company's investment narrative...

headline: How Airbnb’s (ABNB) Hotel Push Has Changed Its Investment Story
summary: Airbnb recently began accelerating its expansion into the global hotel business, launching new job openings in regions such as the U.S., Europe, and Africa and focusing on enlisting boutique and independent hotels to its platform using HotelTonight infrastructure. This marks a significant evolution in Airbnb's business approach, signaling a wider push beyond home-sharing as CEO Brian Chesky targets higher growth rates and greater platform diversification. We'll explore how Airbnb's push to...

headline: Broad Coalition of San Francisco Community Groups and Unions Call for Boycott of Airbnb
summary: On Wednesday, October 8, at 12pm, a broad coalition of community groups and labor unions — including IFPTE Local 21 — gathered in front of the Airbnb headquarters to announce their launch of a boycott of Airbnb. The boycott is motivated by Airbnb's ties to President Trump's anti-worker agenda and massive cuts to public services, its avoidance of business taxes in San Francisco, and its contribution to the housing crisis. Activists are urging San Francisco residents to book elsewhere until Airbnb
